messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] put dishes away
messages.messageBody:
>From: encadia@...

<<FYI - I was at one time constantly washing bath towels, drove my crazy.
My family considered a towel dirty if they just washed their hair. And would
take a new one the next time.
I finally gave each person a nice thick towel, and that was theirs. I hid
the rest! My hubby hated this idea at first, and now it worked perfectly.>>


That's funny. It's just the opposite here. I have tons of towels in both
bathrooms and I always have to go and check with the kids, and hubby too,
that they have put them in the laundry basket. They would let them hang
there forever using the same ones. Ewwwww!!

Mary B

messages.subject: put dishes away
messages.msgSnippet: ... Do you think that if I cut down the number of dishes, and cups, that I wouldn t have to unload them all the time? Thinking I may just have too many and
messages.messageBody:
> I HATE taking the dishes out of the dishwasher and putting them away.
>
> You hit the nail on the head, I have the same problem.
Do you think that if I cut down the number of dishes, and cups, that I
wouldn't have to unload them all the time?
Thinking I may just have too many and need to limit them.

FYI - I was at one time constantly washing bath towels, drove my crazy.
My family considered a towel dirty if they just washed their hair. And would
take a new one the next time.
I finally gave each person a nice thick towel, and that was theirs. I hid the
rest! My hubby hated this idea at first, and now it worked perfectly.




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
